## FAQs (Read these first!) {.unnumbered}

- If you have trouble signing up AWS Academy due to the term item not showing up, it's because of the browser compatibility issue. Try updating your Firefox and then try logging in using Firefox, Chrome, or Edge. [Safari will not work]{.uured-bold}.
- Once you have access to AWS Academy, you will need to activate the account
  - Click on the Account button in the top left corner.
  - The Click on Settings.
  - On the right side panel you will see E-mail addresses and your BU email address below it with an :warning: icon.
  - Click on the :warning: icon to send a verification email to your BU email address.
  - Go to your BU email inbox, open the email from AWS Academy, and click on the verification link.
  - After verifying your email, return to the AWS Academy settings page and refresh it. The :warning: icon should now be replaced with a green check mark, indicating that your email has been successfully verified.

![Activating Email address](../M0/M0_lecture01_figures/awsacademy.settings.emails.png){width="90%" fig-align="center"}


## Learning Outcomes {.unnumbered}

After completing this assignment, you should be able to:

- Summarize generative AI concepts, methods, and strategies.
- Discuss the potential business value and use cases of generative AI.
- Match AWS AI/ML services and features to generative AI use cases.
- Explain how to use foundation models.
- Discuss techniques to refine results of foundation models.
- Recognize the key elements for practicing responsible AI.
- Discuss the security, privacy, and governance considerations for AI systems.
- Describe the workflow and key considerations when developing a generative AI application.

## Questions {.unnumbered}

- Each section of this assignment contains questions that you should either answer or perform in the lab. These are marked with a **Knowledge Check**.
- These Knowledge checks are part of the certificate requirements.
- Completing these will earn you points towards your success in the getting the certificate.


## Submission Details {.unnumbered}

- Submit all deliverables and assignments on AWS Academy Canvas.
- Include a comment on blackboard submission indicating that the AWS Academy course was completed on the **completion date**.
- Ensure all required files are uploaded before the deadline.
- Due on Week 10 Day 6 for All sections, Please check with your instructor.
